issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:

android.view.InputEventReceiver.dispatchInputEvent(InputEventReceiver.java:185 {code} This is the line that causes the crash: {code:java} textoLbl.html = args.destacados; {code} if I put this all works ok (but the html tags aren't parsed) {code:java} textoLbl.text = args.destacados; {code} This only happens when I do scroll. *TEST CASE:* index.xml {code:java} {code} index.js {code:java} textoLbl.html = "

El presente curso reúne tanto aspecto de gestión
del desempeño del trabajo como aspectos de gestión

"; {code}
fields.summary: Android - Ti.UI.Label crash with html property

comments.body:
Hello,
Thanks for reporting. Please share with us simple test code that reproduces this issue. When we are able to reproduce this issue we will be able to identify that if it is valid bug or not.  
Thanks in advance
The test code is above, I've already updated the description.

Hello, 

The issue is with your code. You are setting html property to "textoLbl" but your label id you defined as "tituloLbl". I tested the issue in my environment. There was no error using html property to label 

Regards,
Sharif.
Sorry but it was an error copying here the code. I have a textoLbl and a tituloLbl and I copy here the wrong line. Sorry, I still  having  the problem....

Hello [~amurcia],

As we are not able to reproduce this issue with our test code please provide your full test code and steps to reproduce. We will recognize this as bug when we are able to reproduce the issue.

Thanks in advance
It's easy to reproduce, put a Label with a html property and click in the label. It crashes always, if you put touchEnabled=false too.
